sen.j: 天孫神社（てんそんじんじゃ）は、滋賀県大津市にある神社。
sen.e: Tenson-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture.
Tenson-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture.
Tenson-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 社格は旧県社。
sen.e: It was a prefectural shrine in the old shrine ranking.
It was a prefectural shrine in the old shrine ranking.
It was a prefectural shrine in the old shrine ranking.

sen.j: 由緒
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 延暦年間（782年～806年）の創建と伝えられる。
sen.e: It is said to have been founded during 782-806.
It is said to have been founded during 782-806.
It is said to have been founded during 782-806.

sen.j: はじめ琵琶湖畔にあったが、文明 (日本)年間（1469年～1487年）に現在地に移った。
sen.e: At first it was on the shore of Lake Biwa, but it was relocated to the present place during 1469-1487.
At first it was on the shore of Lake Biwa, but it was relocated to the present place during 1469-1487.
At first it was on the shore of Lake Biwa, but it was relocated to the present place during 1469-1487.

sen.j: 明治維新までは「四宮神社」と称したが、明治初年に現在の社号となった。
sen.e: Until the Meiji Restoration it was referred to as 'Shinomiya-jinja Shrine' but in the first year of the Meiji Period it was given the present shago (title given to a Shinto shrine).
Until the Meiji Restoration it was referred to as 'Shinomiya-jinja Shrine' but in the first year of the Meiji period it was given the present shago (title given to a Shinto shrine).
sen.cmt: the Meiji Period > the Meiji period
sen.e: Until the Meiji Restoration it was referred to as 'Shinomiya-jinja Shrine' but in the first year of the Meiji period it was given the present shago (title given to a Shinto shrine).

sen.j: 祭礼
sen.e: Festivals
Festivals
Festivals

sen.j: 例祭は10月9日から10月10日にかけて行われ、大津祭と称される。
sen.e: The regular festival is held from October 9 to10, and it is called Otsu-matsuri Festival.
The regular festival is held from October 9 to10, and it is called Otsu-matsuri Festival.
The regular festival is held from October 9 to10, and it is called Otsu-matsuri Festival.

sen.j: 日吉大社の山王祭、建部大社の祭礼とともに大津三大祭のひとつに数えられる。
sen.e: It is one of the three major Otsu festivals along with Sanno-sai Festival of Hiyoshi-taisha Shrine and the festival of Takebe-taisha Shrine.
It is one of the three major Otsu festivals along with Sanno-sai Festival of Hiyoshi-taisha Shrine and the festival of Takebe-taisha Shrine.
It is one of the three major Otsu festivals along with Sanno-sai Festival of Hiyoshi-taisha Shrine and the festival of Takebe-taisha Shrine.

sen.j: また、山王祭、長浜曳山とともに湖国三大祭のひとつともなっている。
sen.e: Also it is one of the three major lake province festivals along with Sanno-sai Festival and Nagahama Hikiyama-matsuri festival.
Also it is one of the three major lake province festivals along with Sanno-sai Festival and Nagahama Hikiyama-matsuri Festival.
sen.cmt: Nagahama Hikiyama-matsuri festival > Nagahama Hikiyama-matsuri Festival
sen.e: Also it is one of the three major lake province festivals along with Sanno-sai Festival and Nagahama Hikiyama-matsuri Festival.

sen.j: 10月9日に宵宮があり、10月10日には、13基の曳山（山車）が市内を巡行する。
sen.e: On October 9, the eve of the festival, there is Yoimiya-matsuri, and on October 10, 13 hikiyama (floats) parade in the city.
On October 9, there is Yoimiya (eve of a festival vigil), and on October 10, 13 hikiyama (floats) parade in the city.
sen.cmt: the eve of the festival, there is Yoimiya-matsuri > there is Yoimiya (eve of a festival vigil)
sen.e: On October 9, there is Yoimiya (eve of a festival vigil), and on October 10, 13 hikiyama (floats) parade in the city.

sen.j: 大津祭の起源は、慶長年間（1596年～1615年）とされる。
sen.e: The origin of the Otsu festival is said to have been 1596-1615.
The origin of the Otsu festival is said to have been 1596-1615.
The origin of the Otsu festival is said to have been 1596-1615.

sen.j: 現在10月10日（体育の日）が10月第二月曜日となり、これに合わせその前々日、前日に行われている。
sen.e: Now Physical Education Day, which used to be October 10, has been moved to the second Monday, and so the festival is held for the two days before that.
Now Physical Education Day, which used to be October 10, has been moved to the second Monday, and so the festival is held for the two days before that.
Now Physical Education Day, which used to be October 10, has been moved to the second Monday, and so the festival is held for the two days before that.
